text: Bottle shared at muckfest. The beer is a thick brown with a khaki head of foam. Big roasty caramel and toasty notes. Decent coconut. Hefty dark chocolate notes. Sweet roasty tones. Big body and medium carbonation.
Bottle. muckfest. Leathery. Light oxidation. Lots of fruit and balanced. Well done and balanced. Lotsnofnfudge and fruit.

UPDATED: JUN 15, 2017 250 ml bottle, bottled Dec. 2015, from a trade with GTH, many thanks for this gem!
Black body, with a small, dense, coffee-colored head. 
Aroma of dried fruits, cocoa, toffee, berries, coffee, honey, some wood, some liquorice. 
Tastes similar, with the berries coming through a bit more and some booze. 
Medium, creamy mouthfeel, with a moderate carbonation. 
Finishes smooth, medium sweet, medium roasty, a bit dry, a bit alcoholic, with cocoa, wood, some coffee, some liquorice, some berries. 

Tasty. Very smooth, with the typical notes of the style, which are very well balanced, supported by the subtly integrated berries, coming more through in the taste and especially as the beer warms up. Overall this reminds me more of an Imperial Porter (well the name says it...) and its not among my favourite beers, but still a lovely, smooth sipper, with a lot of subtle quality and a glad opportunity to try this.
Ar/Ap/T/P/Ov: 9/4/8/4/17

0,25l bottle at home shared by Saeglopur, big thanks for this one. Some swedish stufff written on this one. I think it says brewed 10/2014. Bottled 12/2015. black color, small coffee colored head. smells earthy, licorice, bit joghurty, some flowery notes, berries. nice smell overall. full body, light carbonation, slick mouthfeel. tastes earthy, peppery, berry notes, lightly boozy, bit cardboardish, light juniper, hints of joghurt. finishes dryish with notes of earth, berry notes and light cardboard. hmm, not bad but expected a bit more. Maybe a tad overrated, not a big fan on the balance. a bit harsh even. More like a traditional ale than an imp stout. Overall still rather good though.

Bottle at Akkurat. Black color, medium sized brown head. Subtle and balanced aromas of honey, raspberries, chocolate, vanilla, burnt sugar, bourbon, cacao and slight roasted, bitter hints. Taste of sweet raspberries, dark chocolate, alcohol, wood, honey, bourbon and slight hazelnuts. Very happy to have tried it.

25 cL bottle. Black with very little by way of a head. Smells fruity, oaky, and chocolatey. Lots of sugar and alcohol. Its an interesting nose, heavy on the barrel. I thought cherry at first, as the raspberry has almost no acidity. Tastes much more of raspberry. Sharp and a little tart. Bourbon has a much more distinct flavor. Dominates the flavor. Chocolate, licorice, very rich and boozy. Heavy and quite sweet. Really good, but I think the rarity and hype is building this thing up.
Thanks dan. Pours a dark black brown with no head. Aromas of oxidized euro Stout and raspberry.

Bottle. Dark brown pour with a kaki head. Bourbon bouquet. Loads of raspberry up front with chewy caramel and chocolate backbeats. Oak and vanilla lowlights. Really good mouthfeel with a good body. Another gem from the Narke crew.....
Bottle shared thanks to Dan. Poured black with tan head. Aroma strong raspberries some choc. Light carb med bod. Taste nice raspberry fruit with smokey ashy choc malt.

Geproefd tijdens Borefts 2016. Gitzwart van kleur, met een kleine lichtbruine schuimkraag. Schitterende aromas, een geweldige combinatie van fruitigheid en geroosterde notities. Zeer fruitige en verse aanzet, vol frambozen, bosfruit, cocos en bloemige aromas van rozen in een samenspel met bourbon, vanille, chocolade en eikenhout. Het smaakpallet is olieachtig en fruitig tegelijk, erg bijzonder. Eerst proef je een fruitige versheid van frambozen, gevolgd door dessert tonen van koffie, en chocolade, met een laagje bourbon van vanille en eikenhout subtiel er doorheen geblend. de carbonatie is medium, met een dik en olieachtig mondgevoel, de balans van dit bier smelt samen als een vloeibaar dessert. Dit is voor mij de eerste variant die ik proef van de zeldzame Närke Kaggen Stormaktsporter. Zeker een genot voor de zintuigen, voor mij persoonlijk het beste bier van Borefts 2016, absoluut het wachten in de rij waard.

Bottle. Pours a black color with a small tan head. Has a roasted malty woody bourbon chocolate raspberry aroma. Roasted malty woody bourbon chocolate raspberry flavor. Has a roasted malty woody bourbon chocolate raspberry finish.

Backlog. Piwo, dla którego warto było jechać do Norwegii :) Próbowane na festiwalu w Haandbryggeriet. Znakomicie ułożony, deserowy Imperial Stout. W zapachu intensywna mleczna czekolada, maliny, wanilia, lukrecja. W smaku gładkie, kremowe, z bardzo intensywnymi malinami (delikatna cierpkość również obecna), pralinowe, palone, z lekką sugestią słonej lukrecji na finiszu. Świetne.

On tap @BBF16. Small sample. The aroma has raspberries, roasted malts, some dried fruits, vanilla. Black coloured beer with not much head. The taste is very full with raspberries, roast, hint of chocolate and vanilla, some dried fruits. Very delicious and complex.

Bottle at Akkurat. Pours black with a medium brown head which soon recedes. Aroma is oak, slight bourbon, honey. Taste is raspberry sweet, heavy oak, cocoa bitter, slight caramel sweet, a touch of honey. Medium body with a silky body.

On tap at Borefts Bier Festival, 2016. Pours black with brown head. Lots of chocolate in aroma, vanilla, dried fruits, licorice, berries, wood, sweetish with sour cherry twist. Soft carbonation, oily. Full bodied. Cant remember impy with so much fruit in it. Great one.
Poured deep dark brown with a beige head. Aroma of peaty malt, dark berries and dark chocolate. Full body, flavour is as the aroma, nice raspberries.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ by Hans-Göran himself :-)
Schwarz, beiger Schaum. Aroma: Vanille, Malz, Trockenfrüchte und vieles mehr.
Ebenso der Geschmack ein Feuerwerk von Vanille, Malz, Kaffee, Schoklade - und das Ganze trotz der Komplexität mild und ausgewogen - immer wieder ein Hochgenuss!
Sample at Borefts 2016. Black beer, Aroma is raisins, malt. Taste is raisins, raspberry, sweet, some bitterness, malt. nice one,.

Gravity keg at Borefts De Molen Beer Festival 2016 Bodegraven, The Netherlands. 23.09.2016. Pour it dark color with small white head. Aroma vanilla and raspberry. Taste smooth coffee with raspberry finish, vanilla, woody, bourbon feel, perfect match again, leather, basement aromas, licorice, chocolate, roasty, full body, oily feel, soft carbonation, long finish. Worth of waiting in a line for this.
At BBF, opaque very dark brown color, aroma of cherr, intense chocolate cake and pungent minerals, dominant flavor of sour cherries with chocolate, pleasant balancing sweetness. Nice.

@ Akkurat Summer 2016.

Never had a porter/stout with this much of complexity. Insanely complex with fruits, even a bit of smokeyness. Ridiculous!

Sampled at Borefts 2016, Bodegraven. Pitch black pour with an fine-grained espresso head. Notes of subtle bourbon, vanilla, raspberries, light tartness, rose-like perfume, chocolate, molasses, a bit of caramel.

Keg @Borefts 2016. Pours black dark black and thick. Nose and taste is all together there is oak, big fruits, obviously raspberry, vanilla, chocolate. There is liquorice and fruit cake absolutely huge raspberry and some whisky. So raspberry so everything. This would have got a higher mark but right at the back end there was a cardboard note to it and i believe that it might be oxidised.

Thank you for sharing BE RB Crew! Sampled draft @ Borefts 2016. Day 1 + Day 2. Black, little head. Nose is low umami, faint licorice but largely sweet mocha, chocolate syrup faint raspberry. Taste is warming mocha, chocolate, warming basic chocolate syrup, mocha, basic simple, low bitterness, light raspberry jam in the back. Syrupy body, soft carbonation. Pretty lovely beer, lots of fun.

Bue à la pression en 10cl au Borefts de De Molen à Bodegraven
Couleur noire, pas de mousse ni deffervescence
Nez sur le fruit noir et le cassis
En bouche attaque cassis, fruit noire café grillé et caramel bel équilibre final mais on sent un peu trop lalcool !

UPDATED: MAR 5, 2017 2 times sample from [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */: pours black color with tan brown head. Aroma: very intense# dark, roasted malts, peat, bluberries, vanilla, espresso coffee, boubon, port wine...flavor is practically the same: very well balanced. Body is full, texture creamy, carbonation low.
From tap at Borefts 2016. Aroma is raspberry, Bourbon, vanilla, chocolate, prunes, tobacco, dried fruits, oak, dark malt. Flavour is medium sweet. Body is full. Pretty rich and complex.
On tap at Borefts 2016. Black. No head. Jammy aroam. Sour fruits. Medium body. Sweet.
Drank at Borefts 16 with Tijs and Bram. Thanks Michael for the tip about this one. Very interesting beer. Rich, coffee, thick, some cherries, combines really well with the stout- taste.

On tap at Borefts 2016, Bodegraven. 
Nose is raspberry, dried fruits. 
Body is pitch black, head is small, brownish, creamy, mostly diminishing, good lacing. 
Aroma is raspberry, cocoa, herbs, dark chocolate, mild coffee. 
Medium sweet, medium bitter. 
Finish is medium lasting fruity chocolate liquorish medium bitter, light alcohol warmth. 
Full body, oily texture, soft carbonation. 
Relative easy dessert beer, very tasty, great one.
Vollmundig malziger Antrunk. Mild süßlich-würzig, Noten von Karamell, sehr weich und süffig. Vollmundig bleibend, mit der Zeit alkoholischer, etwas kräutrig, lang anhaltend. Honig. 10/12/12/13//13

Gravity pour. Black color with beige head. Aroma is vanilla, oak, chocolate, a little bit of raspberry, slightly oxidized. Taste is vanilla, caramel, oak sugar, not much raspberry. Super-silky mouthfeel. So much flavour and so balanced, its incredible. Excellent and worth its whaliness.
Keg at borefts. Pours black, nose is oak, vanilla, toffee, chocolate, taste is sweet, fruity, tart, roasted, chocolate.

Sampled from tap at Borefts 2016 day 1. Black with thin light tan head. Deep roasted chocolate malts, blueberry, blackberry, big fruity, bourbon. Big roasty molasses. Over medium sweet, medium bitter, light sour. Full body, low carbonation. Very dense and rich in aroma. Fruity sour roasty finish.

Tap at Borefts. Black with short lasting brown head. Sweet dark chocolate, lots of raspberries, some sweet malts, roasted notes, very syrupy raspberry jelly, vanilla, red berries. Over medium sweet and light sour. Full bodied.

On tap @ Stora öl små bryggerier Örebro 2016.
Pitch black with big head.
Sweet fruity aroma with coffee, vanilla and raspberry taste.
Simply great!
Sample at Stora Öl Små Bryggerier 2016 in Örebro. Malty smell with raspberries, caramel, bourbon and wood. Similar taste. Very nice! Not boozy at all.
On tap @ Stora öl små bryggerier 2016. Very dark brown with a small brown head. Fruity and woody tones. Fruit, malt,vanilla wood and hops. Full body with a long bitter/ fruity/ malty finish.

Fat från Stora öl små bryggerier Örebro. Mörk, tjock färg med brun skumkrona. Doft av mörk choklad, fat och hallon. Stor mustig, söt kropp med lite syra. Smak av mörk choklad, fudge, bourbonfat, rostad malt, portvin, hallon och torkade frukter.
UPDATED: SEP 8, 2016 Fat av håge på Stora öl, små bryggerier. Svart med ljusbrunt skum. Lätt syrlig doft med hallon. Tydlig bourbon och lite hallon i smaken.

(250ml bottle shared w/ phyllomedusa @ Akkurat, June 4 2016) Pours nearly black motor oil with a small lingering ring of tan bubbles and spotty lace. Aroma has dark toasted bread, black raspberry, sweet black cherry, dark chocolate, vanilla, oak, subtle bourbon, toasted nuts, tobacco, dry dusty roast. Flavour is chocolate and raspberry cake, berry reduction, dry and tart with a core of toffee, lots of fairly tart raspberry, cacao, wood, dry roast, a little fruit wine, a little whiskey, some dried fruit (craisins?). Finish is lightly tart and exceedingly dry, charred wood, raspberry seeds, spirits, ash. Long aftertaste. Medium full oily body, carb is initially too high and prickly, must be swirled out. Slight alcohol. Quite fruit driven but the backbone is fairly solid in support, though not as unctuous as Konjaks was. Still a seriously nice stout, a nice job from Närke.

Bottled.Clear black color, smallish brown head. Sweet, berries, raspberries, chocolate, alcohol scent. Sweet, berries, salty, alcohol, soy sauce taste. Roasted, salty, berry aftertaste. Warming alcohol. Full smooth mouthfeel, medium bitterness.

Bottle @ Akkurat. Black with a big and lasting dark brown head. Aroma is sweet, roasted malt, chocolate, raspberries, wood, vanilla and bourbon. Flavor is very sweet and rather bitter. Sweet and rather bitter finish with warming alcohol. Oily, soft and smooth. 270716

How: Draught.
Where: Akkurat, Stockholm.
Appearance: Black colour with a beige head.
Aroma: Chocolate, raspberries, bourbon, caramel, some fruit.
Body: Full body, low carbonation.
Flavour: Chocolate, raspberries, bourbon, dried fruit.

Pours dark with low tanned head 
Aromas of bourbon, raspberries, dark chocolate, coffee, molasses 
Taste has notes of raspberries, bourbon, chocolate, molasses, brown sugar, hints of vanilla 
Mouthfeel is smooth, velvet, full bodied, low carbonation, low bitterness

Pours black with a low mocha head. Aromas of raspberry, dark chocolate, bourbon, roasted malt, molasses. Taste is fruity and molasses sweet with roasted notes and moderate bitterness. Mouthfeel is medium bodied with low carbonation.

Pours black with low tan head. Aroma of bourbon, molasses, raspberries, chocolate. Taste is fairly alcohol rich up front, with distinct raspberry notes, the bourbon and alcohol comes strong in the finish. Rich and creamy body with soft carbonation.

Bottled
Black with no head. 
Lovely aroma with dark chocolate, coffee, vinous fruits. 
Very soft and smooth palate. 
Sweet with some raspberries along with milky chocolate, some peaty notes and cold coffee.

10cl sample at Haand beerfestival 2016. It poured a pitch black colour with a minimal brown head. Aroma is lots if liqorice, oak, coffee and roasted malts. Some sweet fruity notes. Alcohol is noticable. Flavour is very smooth. Lots of raspberries, vanilla, coffee, cocoa. Medium long aftertaste.
UPDATED: JUN 4, 2016 Bottle. Interesting beer, but with a little too much going on for my total liking. Notes of leather, wood, dark berries, flower honey, vanilla and a unusually high sourness.

Bottle at Akkurat. 
Tart and boozy taste of chocolate, licorice and raspberries.

Bottle at akkurat 
Deep black brown head
Nice aroma of caramel oat raspberry 
Taste sweet, raspberry 
Slight bitter. Alcoholic.

Bottle at Akkurat, Stockholm. Opaque black beer with a nice lasting beige head. Great chocolate and raspberry aroma, licorice, bourbon, tiny vanilla, cocoa powder, some fruits, caramel, some wood. Raspberry and licorice flavor, raisins, figs, bourbon, woody notes, well hidden alcohol, dark chocolate, some cocoa powder. Delicious with well balanced raspberries.

Draft sample @ Haand fest 16, Drammen. Shared with the Norwegian tasting crew.
Brune, noire opaque, col café au lait, huileux doré au verre.
Arôme de framboise tout simplement divin, presque de confiture de de fruits fraichement récoltés, malté caramel, choco en rétro, le tout semblerait mis en fût de Bourbon, mais je note peu de cela tant la framboise et les malts dominent.

Palais est également fruité mettant la framboise à lhonneur avec un côté râpeux, finement aigrelet et terreux. Cela se combine parfaitement avec le malt versant vers le chocolat. Ici aussi, le résultat de barrique ne me semble pas trop transcendant, mais une fine douceur presque de vanille séveille après qcq minutes et que le tout est ramené à t° ambiante.
A: Deep dark brown coloured N: Maple, raspberry, vanilla, bourbon T: Coffee, raspberry, bourbon, vanilla O: Very well balanced! Super nice nose!

Bottle sample. Pours viscous black with a small creamy dark mocha head that leaves some sparse trace on the glass while dissipating. Smell is malty and fruity with roasted malts, caramel, vanilla fudge, charred wood, dark roast coffee, luxurious dark chocolate, raspberry purée, roasted coconut, moist soil and subtle hints of bourbon alcohol. Taste is sweet, bitter, tiny sour, malty and fruity. Mouthfeel is rich, round, velvety, tiny oily, tiny tart, very tiny boozy and near full bodied. Finish is heavy malty and raspberry fruity with rich chocolaty malts, coffee, raspberries and bourbon. Lovely balance between berries and base beer. No overwhelming tartness or astringency from the berries. A treat!
Black with tan head. Chocolate glazed raspberries, spicy alcohol, sweet, a hint of acidity.

Bottle @ Akkurat. Pours oily pitch black with a small brown head. Aroma is licorice soy roasted malts raspberries coffee chocolate. Flavor is acidy bitter coffee raspberries green apples slightly sweet. Velvety rich mouthfeel, a real sipper.

UPDATED: MAY 16, 2016 Bottle at Akkurat. Aroma has lots of chocolate with a lighter roast note. Balanced bourbon and raspberry notes with raspberry becoming more prevalent as it warms. Pours motor oil black with a slightly reddish sheen on the side of the glass. Small mocha head. Sheets of alcohol. Flavor is like a raspberry truffle. Lots of dessert chocolate with a medium light raspberry note. Light bourbon. Very nice. Medium light bitterness. Lots more raspberry as it warms up. Some light roast notes with hints of dark fruit and tobacco. Mouthfeel is full bodied with medium low carbonation. Low astringency and medium low alcohol warmth. Overall, a very nice beer. The raspberry was integrated very nicely and compliments the base beer very nicely. A very nice porter that should age very well.

Bottle at Akkurat - pours dark black w/ brown head. Nose is bourbon, chocolate, oak nicely balanced w/ raspberries. Taste is chocolate and raspberries nicely blended together. Some bourbon, oak, and vanilla. The mouthfeel was rich and decadent.

Smakprov (fat) på Närke Kulturbryggeri, öppet hus på Småbryggeriernas dag. Svart med fluffigt mörkbrunt skum. Doft av kola, toffee, lite vanilj, soja, chark, lite kaffe, lakrits. Hallonen inte särskilt framträdande i doften. Desto mer i smaken. Ganska snabbt framträder en rejäl bärig syra med mycket råg, bourbon och kaffesyra. Kroppen är åt det större hållet. Här finns även körsbär och något vinösa toner. Bärigheten, som intar främsta platsen i smakbilden, går över i något torrare, mer välrostade toner i avslutningen.

Bottled at Akkurat, Stockholm.  Black with rich beige head. Tart raspberry aroma with chocolate and licorice behind. Mid sweet with full bodyand rounded mouthfeel. Chocolate and tart raspberries dominate. Warming finish with low bitterness. Good, but not magnificent.

250 ml bottle. Bottled on Dec/2015. At the Akkurat, Stockholm, Sweden.
Pitch black color with a tiny light tan head. 
Roasted malt, strongness, red wine, red berries and some dryness in the aroma. The flavor is red wine, wood, dryness, sawdust, alcohol, raspberry jam and roasted malt. Warms. Balanced and flavorsome.

April 23, 2016. Bottle at Akkurat. 
Black with a small brown head. Aroma is roasted malts, dark chocolate, bourbon, salty licorice, vanilla, caramel and raspberries. Taste is medium sweet, light berry tartness and medium roasted bitterness. Finish is light sweet with notes of toffee, vanilla and bourbon, some tart raspberries and light to medium roasted bitterness with dark chocolate and slight woody notes. Medium to full bodied, oily texture up front but falls apart towards the end and feels a bit thin in the finish. 
Very good, not a fan of mixing sour and roasted but this worked quite well, not too much berry tartness and balanced roastiness.

Bottle at Akkurat. (265 sek)

Black with a small tan head. Aroma of raspberries, bourbon, chocolate, oak and some roasted malt. Similar taste. Very smooth and elegant. Yet another incredible beer from Närke Kulturbryggeri.
@ Akkurat 16-4-9: En härlig kombination av en perfekt stormaktsporter med en trevlig syrlig underton. Len och tydlig eftersmak. Extremt elegant.

Draught. Opaque black liquid with small to medium tan head. Aroma of chocolate, bourbon, raspberries, light licorice, light raw sugar and light leather. Taste is light to medium sweet and light bitter with notes of raspberries, light chocolate, light licorice, raw sugar and light bourbon. Full bodied with low to medium carbonation. Super good! Lots of raspberries.

Tap att Akkurats 20th Anniversary. Pitch black pour with small tan head. Aroma of red fruits, chocolate, some roast and whisky. Very oak heavy taste with raspberries, red currant, roasted malt and chocolate. Just think the barrel notes are too heavy.

On Tap at Akkurats 20th Anniversary. Pitch black, small tanned head. Rich aroma, bourbon, vanilla, licorice, oak and cherry. Oily smooth mouthfeel, gentle carbonated. Sweet vanilla and warming bourbon mixed with rosted notes and dark chocolate with fruity notes from cherry and raspberry. Rich and complex.

Aroma of bourbon, light booze, licorice, cherry/red berries, slight smoke. Taste of coffee, oak, bourbon with a vinous note that balances it quite well, a vanilla touch that makes it a whole lot better than the normal Stormaktsporter, but a bit too vinous and too low pH, which I think masks the chocolate and gives it a bit too harsh roast.

Köpt på Akkurat, Stockholm. Mycket stora och välgjorda smaker, mycket intressant! 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
The sourness is refreshing, but it somewhat makes the beer not that balance to be a top of the line beer. But wow.

Fra kran på Haand Ølfestival 29 Mai 15. Kullsort. Lavt mokkafarget skum. Sammensatt aroma. Behagelig. Litt bringebær & svakt røkt malt. Smaken det samme. Herlig blanding av bær & røstet malt. Lettdrikkelig.

Haand Ølfestival 2015. Black colour with a tan head. Aroma is raspberry, alcohol, coffee, chocolate. Flavour is raspberries, chocolate, coffee, licorice, roasted malt. Full body. Very nice beer. For en nytelse . Dette var godt.

Black with a small brown head - Good dark malt aroma with some berry notes and some woody notes as well - Good dark malt body with chocolate and a nice berry flavour that blends in well - The dark malts and berries goes into a lon finish that lasts - This was just a real treat

From tap at Borefts 14. Pours pitch black with a small tan head. Aroma has roasted malts, dark chocolate and some sweet raspberry all in nice balance. Taste has quite some raspberry, licorice, dark fruits, roasted malts and some alcohol. Full body, soft to medium carbo. Nice stuff, highlight of the festival for me.

On tap at Haand Festival. A black one, topped by a dense, finger-thick dark beige head. Theres a light raspberry touch in the aroma, its quite boozy, with roasted malts, coffee, chocolate and hints of vanilla. Its super smooth and deliciously full-bodied with a nice carbonation level. Some alcohol warmth. The raspberries are more evident in the flavor, still its the roasted matls, coffee and chocolate that run the show. Lasting lightly boozy finish with raspberry and dark malts. Sure a delicious one, a beer to be enjoyed in silience, not at a noisy festival. 150529

On tap @ HaandFestival 2015. Pitch black body, small beige head. Nose is raspberries, licorice, coffee, leather, dark fruits, smoke, tar and hints of dark malts, grains and dark syrup. Taste is leather, raspberries, smoke, licorice, dark fruits and hints of coffee, dark chocolate and tar. Full body, medium carbonation. Pleasant, and a classic combo of fruity and chocolat-y tastes, but not quite as convincing as the regular version, to say the least.

Well what is ther to say? Just an unbelievable nice and tasty is. How they manage to get this smooth raspberry feeling into this heavy beer is a miracle. Served a little bit to cold at the festival. Maybe a little trick to calm us down. Had to sit down for a while and relax while the temperature was rising. Lot of time for my nose to feel the awakening. And I was smart enough to use two tokens. Double up please. Monster beer. Can not find anything wrong with it. Smooth balanced raspberry with a mellow chocolate. Hell yeah.[On tap at Haand 15 in Drammen, Norway]

The only thing I can think of that isnt close to perfect with this masterpiece, is that it was served at approximately -272 ºC. Its very strange that a dead serious company like Närke can make a mistake like that. Apart from this: pure perfection! It pours a black, viscous body with a creamy, medium brown to maroon, very long-lived head that laces my glass excellently. The aroma is strong and malty with amazing roasted notes of chocolate overdose, dark caramel, vanilla and a faint fruity background. Far in the back there are vague hints of berries. The flavour is very strong, extraordinarily complex and utterly delicious. Again lots and lots of dark chocolate, but equally strong are the raspberries. This is like drinking raspberry chocolate! There are also other roasted malty notes with coffee, and vanilla in the back. The initial taste is moderate sweet, but very soon a refreshing acidity from the raspberries kicks in, followed by an everlasting moderate bitterness. This is a perfectly balanced beer: on once side there is the sweet taste and the chocolate flavour, on the other there is acidity, bitterness and crisp raspberries. Amazing! The mouthfeel is very pleasant, its full-bodied, oily and with a soft carbonation. One of the very best beers Ive ever tried. I deeply regret that I only had a tiny 1 dl sample, I should have drunk this divine brew all evening. 
[10 cl sample from tap @ Haand ølfestival, Drammen]

Draught @ Haand Ølfestival 2015, Drammen
Pours black with a tan head. Aroma has notes of roasted malt, chocolate, oak, berry and dried fruits. Taste is heavy sweet and medium bitter with along warm, chocolate and raspberry finish. Body is full, texture is oily, carbonation is soft.. One of the best raspberry beers I have ever had.

100ml on tap at Haand Ølfestival. Slowly diminishing head leaving spotty lacing behind. Black as pitch. Attractive aroma of dark fruit, dark malts and wood. Nicely roasted taste of dark fruits, cocoa, toffee with a sheer raspberry twist. Lingering aftertaste of malt and mid-tart berries. Full bodied. One of the very best at the festival (Drammen 29.05.2015).
Pours black, no head. Aroma is woody, barrel aged? slightly sour. Taste is balanced, raspberries first some coffee on finish.

On tap at Haandbryggeriet Beer Festival. Pitch black with a creamy, chocolate brown head. Aroma of roasted malt with lovely raspberry notes, dark chocolate, some wooden notes and hints of balsamic vinegar. Sweet, but balanced with nice acidic note and lovely mixture of dark chocolate and raspberries in the flavour. Complex and very enjoyable. Delicious!
Svart med lavt espressofarget skum. Aromaen av bær, vanilje samt noe kaffe. I smaken er det bær og kaffe. Tykk konsistens.

26.09.2014, tap sample @ Borefts:
Small brown creamy mediumlasting head. Aroma is rich and slightly sweet, dark malts, dark sugar, chocolate, whisky, grass, coffee, burnt caramel, hints of raspberries, vanilla and peat. Taste is sour-ish dry, oak, sour coffee, whisky, leather, hay, grass, burnt caramel, peat, hints of raspberries. Medium to longlasting bitterness, dry sour-ish mouthfeel. Nice.

(Närke Kaggen Raspberry Stormaktsporter) On tap at Borefts, probably the best of the festival for me. Totally black pour with a good sized dark brown head, with good retention and medium lacing left behind.
Very nice aroma, raspberries, very fruity. Light alcohol and vanilla follow.
Fantastic taste, vanilla, raspeberries, ends with some roasted malts and more raspberries, sweet but with a nice sour touch to balance it.
Medium thick body with soft carbonation, sticky on the palate, with a smooth, creamy texture.
Great beer, one of the few I went back for seconds.

Tap at Borefts Beer Festival 2014. Pours a nice, jet black with a lovely, long lasting, brown head. Aroma is pretty roasty with some tart nuances, caramel, chocolate and maybe a hint of smoke. Taste has burned sugar, brown sugar and syrup sweetness up front, with a bit of raspberry tartness. Aftertaste has a nice roasty bitterness and dark, dry chocolate. Fairly high carbonation actually, and a full body. Works fine with the raspberry, though i would still prefer tasting the original beer.

Keg at Borefts day1 26/09/2014. Bodegraven. Opaque black with a nice medium tan head. Aroma is nutty, caramel, chocolate, smokey and rich. Flavour is composed of rounded malts, choc, caramel, nutty, smokey wood, some hot alcohol, warming. Palate is full bodied, melts on the tongue. Beautiful. Suberb beer. Lovely tangy raspberry fruit in the finish really adds something.
Draft @ borefts. Aroma is huge mocca, roast, light fruits, liquorice, light smoke. Pfieuw. Flavour is raspberry covered in chocolate with roast and liquorice and more LRAB.
At Borefts 2014.Gorgeous foam, black. Aroma of raspberries, roast, dry, malty. Taste is raspberries, chocolate, little sour light finish. Awsome!

26th September 2014Borefts VI. Keg. Opaque dark brown beer, small pale tan head. Palate is airy and semi dry. modest fine carbonation. Smooth rich dark malts. Mellow dark chocolate and coffee. Dry malt cream. The raspberries integrate really well and provides an overall lift. Light airy finish. Nicely joined up and drinkable.

Draught @ 6th Borefts Beer Festival 2014, Brouwerij de Molen, Bodegraven, Netherlands. [ As Närke Kaggen Raspberry Stormaktsporter ].Clear dark black color with a average, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, beige head. Aroma is moderate to heavy malty, roasted, coffee, chocolate, rapsberry, fruity raspberry. Flavour is moderate to heavy sweet and moderate bitter with a long duration, chocolate, raspberries. Body is medium, texture is oily - creamry, carbonation is soft. [20140926]
Tasted @ BBF 2014. This was the better of the two Kaggens this year. This one was amazingly balanced and the fruity raspberries really accompanied the thick Kaggen body well. Great stuff.
Draught at Borefts BeerFest 2014. Pitch black - brown head. Burned, lots of raspberries, light marmelade notes, wooden, light candy, stickey sweetness, a bit simple.

UPDATED: OCT 2, 2016 Improved from a 3.7 to a 4.3 - Black with thin head. Aroma has lightly perfumed raspberry. Flavour is a grand mix of raspberries and dark roasted malts. Quite sticky in the finish.

Sampled @ Borefts 2014. Pours a pitch black beer with a nice creamy off white head on top. Aroma of oak, raspberry, bourbon and loads of red fruits. Flavor is oaky, again very fruity and light sour. Also has a faint sweetness in the finish. Nice balance between sweet & sour with great imperial stout characters.. Amazing stuff..

Draught at Borefts Bier Festival 2014. 
Pitch black coloured with a small beige head.
Sweet and roasted aroma of raspberries and whisky.
Roasted flavour of raspberries, oak, dark chocolate, whisky and alcohol.
Roasted finish.

Pours near black with a beige head. Aroma of red fruits, raspberry, roast, dark chocolate, caramel and fudge. Flavour is heavy sweet and moderate bitter. Thick and oily mouthfeel. Full bodied with soft carbonation.

26/IX/14 - on tap @ Borefts 2014 (Bodegraven) - BB: n/a (2014-1066) Thanks to Benzai, 77ships, fonefan and cgarvieuk for sharing todays beers!
Clear dark brown beer, big creamy dark brown head, very stable, bit adhesive. Aroma: raspberry jam, sweet, sugary. MF: ok carbon, medium to full body. Taste: sourish start, lots of raspberry jam, milk chocolate, soft sourness. Aftertaste: very fruity, sweet, raspberry jam, some chocolate, not too sugary. Nicely done!

From tap. Pours pitch black with a small tan head. Aroma is roasted dark malty, mild raspberry fruity. Hick chocolate malty, rasberry fruity. Light sweetness, mild acidity. Lingering dark roasted almost tarish finish.

UPDATED: OCT 15, 2016 Re-rate 9/24/16: Draught sample at Borefts Beer Festival 2016 in Bodegraven. Day two. Black with a tan head. Aroma of bourbon, chocolate, fudge, cookies, vanilla, raspberries. Sweet flavor with a tart note. Full-bodied, silky. Great. 8/4/8/4/16=4

[9/26/14] Draught sample at Borefts Beer Festival 2014 in Bodegraven. Black with a brown head. Great aroma with lots of chocolate, vanilla, bourbon and some berries. Sweet flavor with bourbon lots of chocolate, vanilla and a bit of raspberry with a light tart touch. Full-bodied. Great. 8/4/8/4/16=4
Tap @ De Molen Beerfestival 2014. Pours black with a creamy head and lacings. Wood, roast and vague raspberries. Smooth and soft. Slick. Lovely!

Tap at Borefts Bier Festival 2014. Whan a nice surprise to bring to the festival! Being a fan both of Kaggen and fruit beers, mixing the two together cant be wrong, or can it? Answering to this years festivals Radler challenge by taking one of the worlds most sought after beers and blending it out with fruit juice, without announcing the base of the beer before the festival is a cool idea anyway you look at it. It would be unfair of me to compare this one to the original Kaggen, both because its pretty close to 4 years since I had it, but also since this is an occasion-themed variation. Still, I think its safe to say that this version wont challenge the originals status. The beer itself is all black, with a dark brown head. Yeah, you know, the Kaggen look. Aroma starts roasty with dark fruits, licorice, mild berry notes, not totally overtaking the beer luckily, with subtle oak notes. Taste is more or less as expected, a solid thick Roasty chocolate body, pleasant mild vanilla and wood, with a fruity touch I like to believe is the berries. Thick and massive, its like it melts in my mouth even though I am aware of the fact that beer is already liquid. Balanced bitterness, extremely pleasant dark finish. I love it!

Tap at BBF14. Compared to the cassis laphroiag way more balanced, yet raspberries and stout remain a peculliar combination. Sweet balance between raspberry fruit and chocolate /cacao bean roast. Nice.

tap @ Borefts 2014.
Pour pitch black, with a small creamy tan head.
Aroma has plenty of chocolate, some roasted coffee, cacao powder, slightly sour berry notes, oatmeal. Taste is slightly sweet up front, with a nice amount of roasted bitterness.
Semi full bodied, with a slightly creamy flat carb. Pretty delicious and complex.

On tap @ Borefts 2014. Pours black with a tan head. the smell is rich roasted malt, molasses, caramel, dark fruit. The taste follows the nose with the raspberries coming through as well. Medium/full body. One of the best beers of the festival!

Keg at Borefts 6, day 1, 26/09/14.
Pitch black with a good sized tan covering.
Nose is big roast, smoke, molasses, spice, bitter chocolate, subtle berry tones.
Taste comprises much richer berry and raspberry notes, dark malts, chocolate, light smoke.
Medium + body, fine carbonation, semi drying close.
Very drinkable impy, the alcohol is well integrated.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text:
UPDATED: DEC 29, 2014 Sampled at Borefts Beer Festival 2014. THX everyone for sharing todays beers.
Pitch black beer. Nose is raspberries, oak, chocolate, coffee, nice! Taste is little sour, raspberries, fruity, oak, chocolate, coffee. Very nice!

Draft @ Borefts 2014. Unaware of this gem, I ordered the first beer of Borefts 2014. While receiving my drink, from the corner of my eye I caught the words Kaggen Stormaksporter on the neighbouring brew stand. Of course I immediately cued up for this marvel and chose the Raspberry first. What an amazing beer. Thick, black and oily. Rich aroma of malt, coffee and dark fruit. Complex and diverse taste of dark coffee, pure cacao, smooth raspberry and some delicious vanilla of the Bourbon aging this beer has had. Aftertaste is long and evolving. A shame I only got to drink one, since this beer was finished in no-time.

On tap @ Borefts 2014, Bodefraven Netherlands. Black color with a dark brown head. Aromas of chocolate, aramel, coffee, dark fruits. Taste was exceptional. Chocolate, coffee, dark fruits, plums, berries. Long aftertaste. Full bodu with low to medium carbonation.

15cl tasting @ Borefts beer festival (27-9-14). Very dark brown colour, thin brown foamy head. Firm stout with cream, chocolate, coffee and roasted tones along with a sweet and sour raspberry finish. Low carbonation, big body with a firm alcoholic punch, sticky mouthfeel.

UPDATED: OCT 2, 2016 Tap @ Borefts 2014. Black. Vanilla and honey in the complex aroma. Oak, vanilla, honey, roast in the flavor. Some raspberryjuice noticeable in the background. Full bodied. Salt, licorice. Strong roast finish.

Tap @ Borefts 2016. Malty sweet. Honey and raspberry in the aroma and flavor.

Tap @ Borefts 2014. Black color. Dense light brown head. Aromas: roasted, soy sauce, raspberries, with light saltiness/umami retronasal. Flavor is moderate sweet, chocolate, light fruity sourness, roast. Quite strong alcohol feel. Medium to full bodied. Roast in the finish. A great surprise from Närke.

On tap at Borefts Festival 2014. Comes black with a decent tan head. Lovely aroma of malt, chocolate, coffee, and fruit. Taste is roasted malt, dark chocolate, coffee, and raspberry. Very rich and very tasty.

Tap at Borefts 2014. Pours pitch black with a frothy thick mocca head. Aromas of sour (rasp)berries, slight smoke and licorice, some burned coffee notes. Slightly alcoholic. Taste is pretty sour berries up front, homemade raspberry sorbet, licorice, roasted coffee, sourness settles slightly, dry bittersweet chocolate finish.

Borefts Beer Festival 2014. Black with a lasting light brown head. Deep, dark aroma with chocolate and cocoa, coconut, licorice and vanilla. Sweet and rich flavour with chocolate and bourbon, a touch of sweet raspberry notes and a hint of tartness in the finish. Kaggen in its usual splendor, with a slightly heavy (young) barrel character, and very little added from the berries

On tap at Borefts 2014. Black with a good brown head. Aroma is coffee, chocolate, raspberry, dark fruits, caramel, honeycomb. Full bodied, velvetty mouthfeel, rich and lightly sweet in the palate with a perfect balance of roasty bitterness, warming finish. Taste is raspberry, coffee, chocolate, caramel, blackcurrant, golden syrup.
Borefts 2014. Poured deep dark brown with a beige head. Aroma of peaty malt, dark berries and dark chocolate. Full body, flavour is as the aroma, nice raspberries.
On tap at Borefts 2014. Black beer lasting tan head. Very thick in mouth. Lots of thick chocolate. Some raspberry. Good.

Tap at Borefts 2014. Poured a dark mahogany with a frothy tan head. The aroma is rich roasted malt, molasses raspberry. The flavour is moderate sweet light bitter with a smooth alcoholic roasted malt raspberry molasses palate. Full bodied with soft carbonation. A whale indeed!

Deep dark body and stable head. Heavy fruited, complex, thick. Roasted, raspberry. Red berries and not too sweet. Still not quite balanced but it perhaps shouldnt be a hit theres so much to explore and love. Wow, unexpected (not if the brewer but of the combination) stunner! (On tap at Borefts 2014)

Tap @ Borefts 2014, small sample. Dark color, brown head. Aroma of roasted malts, dark chocolate, honey, caramel, hint of raspberry. Sweet in taste, thick, bitter from malts. Like the original Kaggen but with an extra fruity hint. Wonderful stuff. Although its still blasphemy to the Kaggen. :P

Well, Im a stormaktsporter-fan, but Im not the biggest fan of raspberries, so this was interesting. Afterall, the Stormaktsporter was there still in front, but still, this addition slightly ruined this brew for me. Yes, its an pretty high score, and ofcourse it was very tasty. But if I compare this with how the base-beer tasted back in the days (and not so long ago another bottle Ive tasted), this is just the right score. Good to very good. Nothing more.

Tap @ BBF 14. Welcome to borefts beer festival. Here is a stormaktsporter made with raspberries - Enjoy your stay! .... Ok! Pours black with a dense brown head. Aroma of dark dense chocolate along with the fruity raspberries which comes off as an mildly acidic kinda note. Also some roasted coffee and fudge. Taste has those same notes. Lots of sweetness along with fresh acidic notes from the raspberries. Roasted coffee is there as well. Just overall like a brownie served with raspberry sorbet and a cup of coffee on the side. Thick full body. Excellent!

On tap at Borefts 14. Black colour, beige-brown head. Aroma of some bourbon, oak, subtle raspberries, chocolate, heavy roast, tar, coffee, some booze. Flavour is sweet and bitter, liquorice, roast, tar, light tartness, raspberries are there, chocolate, some oak, coffee, bittersweet finish. Medium to full-bodied. Good.

At BBF 2014 . 
Pours black, big grey head . 
Smell is earthy . Dark malts , bit of fruit . 
Taste is bitter , black malts . Raspberrys . Rather high carbo . Aftertaste is bitter & fruity . Very intense on the raspberry side ( which I love ) withoud losing touch with the basics of an Imperial stout . Very intense, but just like its brother on laphroaigh , it suffers from lack of a good body . Still very nice though, and one of my personal favourites of the festival

Had this at Borefts BF, Bodegraven, Netherlands, Friday 26th September 2014.   Pours black with tiny bubbly tan head. Soft, creamy mouthfeel however, the alcohol leaves a little harshness, Loz prefers this to me. The raspberries are not as in yer face as I would have liked but theyre there and add a great tartness. Good but not great. 
  A7 A4 T7 P4 Ov14 3.6

UPDATED: SEP 30, 2014 [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ 14: Served in a De Molen taster: 
Thos was the total surprise of the festival. Specially as I started with this one and wanted to end with this one too (after I tasted it). Unfortunately it was all gone at the end of day one. Nevertheless a marvelous almost flawless beer with a subliminal and supreme melting of style and fruit. Just awesome!
Black beer. Brown head.
Aromas of bourbon, roast, some pencil sharpener, red fruit, roast, cream...
Roast, enough (perfectly balanced) red fruit, some bourbon, silky, smooth, some bitters, full, round, some chocolate.... Awesome!
No to low carbo, intensely creamy silky mouthfeel, full bodied and a cream, oily thick texture. I love red fruit and I love Kaggen (tasted it once at the 2nd Borefts but didnt make notes...) Anyways, this is one of the most brilliant beers ever tasted! Awesomely balanced, very smooth, great taste, just close to perfect! Sublime!
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text: Sampled @ Borefts 2014. Opaque pitch black color, medium sized dark brown head. Smell and taste malts, dark malts, some roast, a hint of coffee, liquor, rich full malty taste. Lovely, even though I dont get raspberry. Medium to full body and carbonation.
slight brown head. coffee coloured. aroma of coconut and raspberry. taste is more of the aroma. rather dense mouthfeel, soft carbonation.  draft @ borefts 14

UPDATED: SEP 23, 2016 Keg at the de molen festival... Deep black... Thick tan head... Dark meaty woody malys... Dark roast... Deep meaty malts... Chocolate roast... Light raspberry... Mellow chocolate.. Tk 2 later in day... Deep black.. Deep roast.. Dark chocolate malts... Deep roast... Dark meaty malts.. Mellow roast malts.. Chewy chocolate... Big soft mellow raspberry


Keg at borefts 2016... Dark black.. Thin tan lacing.. Soft meaty chocolate Roast malts nose.. Dark chocolate.. Rich meaty malts... Light oxidisation.. Dark Roast 4.0

Sampled this amazing stuff @Borefts 14. Pitch black colour with a light brown head. Smells vanilla, roasty, coffee, chocolate, lovely sweet. Tastes vanilla, sweet, coffee, roasty, slightly fruity.. Like a lovely dessert. Amazing beer. Full body, soft carbo.
sampled @ Borefts Beer Festival 2014: schwarzes Bier mit schöner bräunlichen Schaumkrone. Geruch holzig, röstmalzig, Kaffee. Geschmack holzig, reife Früchte, alkoholisch, Kaffee.

On tap a borefts.
Thin tan head. Clear jet black pour. Lovely rich taste with subtle rapberries. Awesome.
Tap at Borefts14: Very black coloured brew with an well balanced bitter taste. Hints of chocolate, vanilla, smoked and that wonderful raspberry they used.

Draught at Borefts 14. Very dark brown with a small tan head. Medium to full body with low carbonation. Quite sweet, with smokey and bitter tones. Roasted malts, red fruits, chocolate, caramel, vanilla, oak and bourbon. Quite a nice full flavoured smokey imperial stout. Loved this one.

huray huray... reached my 1000th review during BBF festival. and this was just the perfect beer during borefts to celebrate this achievement. what a suprise they had this one. it was by far the best beer (for me) during the day. small sample from draft. poured a deep dark black colour with a nice mocha coloured head. there is definitely red fruits (raspberries) in the aroma. but not overwelming. strong chocolate, roasted malts, caramel, oak, licorice, vanilla, oak, bourbon. the raspberry really kicks in with the first sip! its like eating a fresh raspberry with a big thick stout! really complex and balanced with the stout and the fruit part. barrel notice is not overwelming but its there. incredible!

Tap at Borefts 2014. Pours near black with a beige head. Aroma of red fruits, raspberry, roast, dark chocolate, caramel and fudge. Flavour is heavy sweet and moderate bitter. Thick and oily mouthfeel. Full bodied with soft carbonation. An excellent re-introduction of a Kaggen varient!
